text: Is it possible to have two different search result page templates? For example if I have a site search on our website and one for our blog and I want the blog template to mirror the template of the blog.
you might be able to by adding a query param and checking for that query param then choosing the template used based on its value

basically you’d have a coded template acting as a switcher for which other template you’d use for the search results.

The page URL for the results would be the same except the parameter.

There might be an easier way - I haven’t personally dabbled a ton with the new site search feature, but this would work.
Easier way would be just to have a separate page for your blog search under a different slug
And clone/edit the search input module to create a blog search input module that points to that slug instead of the site search page
^ specifically swap out `{{ site_settings.content_search_results_page_path }}` the new results pages’s slug in both search modules

Has anyone else found that published changes to the search templates takes a long time to show live? I've found that sometimes it even jumps back to older versions a couple publishes back. Is this possibly caching issue on HubSpot's side? I've cleared all of my browsing data and nothing seems to help.

it’s likely HS caching, try adding a query param if you see your changes show up, then it’s just the HS cache.

If you want a handy tool for busting the cache, there’s a chrome extension <https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/HubSpot-developer-extensi/gebemkdecnlgbcanplbgdpcffpdnfdfo>

If you find the extension useful or have feedback you can let us know in <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension>
